results.headline: Review: In ‘The Great Man,’ Friendship and Politics in a War Zone
results.summary_short: In this Sarah Leonor drama, two French soldiers’ lives change after a near-death experience in Afghanistan.

results.headline: Review: ‘Fort Tilden,’ a Comic Odyssey to the Beach
results.summary_short: Two self-centered young women from New York embark on a picaresque bike ride and encounter all sorts of complications.

results.headline: Review: ‘The Man From U.N.C.L.E.’ Resurrects a Glossy, Action-Packed ’60s
results.summary_short: Guy Ritchie’s big-screen rendering of the 1960s television series tries hard not to be a museum piece, partly with a slick, agitated style.

results.headline: Review: ‘Tango Negro’ Explores the Roots of a Dance and Musical Genre
results.summary_short: The director Dom Pedro sets a breezy tone in this documentary, which theorizes that this Latin American art form has a deep connection with Africa.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Return to Sender,’ Rosamund Pike Connects With Her Attacker
results.summary_short: A rapist’s victim visits him in prison, raising the question of whether she’s interested in his rehabilitation or something else.

results.headline: Review: In ‘People Places Things,’ Jemaine Clement Navigates Life as a Newly Single Dad
results.summary_short: In Jim Strouse’s comedy, Mr. Clement plays a graphic artist, teacher and father who must start over after his wife betrays him.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Big Sky,’ Starring Bella Thorne, Mortal Fears Collide
results.summary_short: Ms. Thorne plays a teenager with a dread of open spaces who must surmount her terror to save her mother and herself.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Air,’ Norman Reedus and Djimon Hounsou Keep Hope, and Themselves, Alive
results.summary_short: In this sci-fi film set in an underground missile silo, the actions of two men could decide the fate of civilization.

results.headline: Review: ‘How to Smell a Rose,’ Ricky Leacock at His French Farmhouse
results.summary_short: The filmmakers Les Blank and Gina Leibrecht make a documentary about Mr. Leacock, and ask about documentary films.

results.headline: Review: ‘The Gift,’ a Stalker Thriller That Isn’t What It Seems
results.summary_short: Directed by Joel Edgerton, this movie about a prosperous couple and their ominous new acquaintance takes several turns even after abandoning its formulaic premise.

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Diary of a Teenage Girl,’ a Hormone Bomb Waiting to Explode

results.headline: Review: ‘God Bless the Child’ Follows Neglected Siblings at Play
results.summary_short: Robert Machoian and Rodrigo Ojeda-Beck’s drama creates a seemingly oblivious world of make-believe, goofing off and hanging out after a mother distressingly drives off.

results.headline: Review: ‘The Runner’ Stars Nicolas Cage as a Politician After an Oil Spill
results.summary_short: Written and directed by Austin Stark, this movie follows a Louisiana congressman trying to clean up his life after the Deepwater Horizon catastrophe.

results.headline: Review: ‘Ricki and the Flash’ Puts Meryl Streep Behind a Telecaster
results.summary_short: Diablo Cody wrote and Jonathan Demme directed this film about a rocker who returns to mend a crisis in the family she abandoned.

results.headline: Review: ‘Kahlil Gibran’s The Prophet’ Turns Essays Into a Family Movie
results.summary_short: This animated film, based on a volume of poetic writings by that early-20th-century Lebanese writer, is determined to sanctify its subject.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Sneakerheadz,’ an Obsession Over Something More Than Footwear
results.summary_short: This fans-only documentary about sneaker enthusiasts draws connections among style, sports and popular culture.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Cop Car,’ a Joyride by 2 Runaway Boys Takes a Wrong Turn
results.summary_short: Jon Watts’s film, in its self-consciousness and breezy, instrumental violence, ambitiously announces itself as the latest spawn of neo-exploitation artists like Quentin Tarantino.

results.headline: Review: ‘Homme Less’ Follows a Homeless Middle-Age Model-Photographer
results.summary_short: A documentary shows a former model who hits the runway shows and parties late into the night, while storing his belongings in a Y.M.C.A. locker and sleeping on a roof.

results.headline: Review: ‘Fantastic Four,’ the Reboot (Wanted or Not)

results.headline: Review: ‘Call Me Lucky,’ About the Comedian-Activist Barry Crimmins
